info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued May 5 at 11:15PM EDT until May 6 at 4:00AM EDT by NWS Cleveland OH
info.description:
FFWCLE
The National Weather Service in Cleveland has issued a
* Flash Flood Warning for... Lucas County in northwestern Ohio...
* Until 400 AM EDT.
* At 1115 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly.
HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms.
SOURCE...Radar.
IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas.
* Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Toledo, Perrysburg, Oregon, Sylvania, Rossford, Holland, Maumee, Ottawa Hills, Berkey, Harbor View, Reno Beach and Bono.
Lucas County 911 Dispatch has reported some minor flooding issues including flooding of low-lying roads and typical high water spots. However, continued steady rainfall may increase the flooding severity across the Toledo Metro area overnight.
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
